conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves.
The shadows are cast by the objects on the ground, and their position relative to the light source will determine how they appear.
The objects are a bulletin board, a calendar, a toilet paper holder, and a postcard. The shadows are labeled A, B, C, and D.
The shadows cast by the objects will change based on the position of the light source relative to the objects.
Consider the movement of the light source. If the light source moves to the back left or right, the shadows will shift accordingly.

premise: The shadow of the light source will move to the opposite side of the objects when the light source moves.
conclusion: This will affect the size and position of the shadows.

premise: If the light source moves to the back left, the shadow of the toilet paper holder will move to the back right.
conclusion: Similarly, if it moves to the back right, the shadow will move to the back left.

premise: Based on the analysis, the shadow of the toilet paper holder will move to the back right when the light source moves to the back left, and to the back left when it moves to the back right.
conclusion: The shadow of the toilet paper holder will move to the back right when the light source moves to the back left, and to the back left when it moves to the back right.
